column4: how do I make a link to /home/.wine/drive_c/Program Files/Mozilla Firefox/firefox.exe ????
plugins
same question as fistfullofroses'
flash player won't play v.7, as well as cannot get shockwave to work
ln -s /complex/path /more/accessible/path
I'd suggest creating ~/bin, export PATH=$PATH:~/bin
I totally didn't understand that at all?
which part?
what exactly should I be typing ??? in term???
that latter comment was an instruction on adding an extra path for your shell session where you can place a symlink (ln -s) to your firefox program
yes, at the command line
so type ~/bin, export PATH=$PATH:~/bin??? just like that?
so what about placing a shortcut on the desktop?
mkdir ~/bin ; ln -s  /home/.wine/drive_c/Program Files/Mozilla Firefox/firefox.exe ~/bin/winefox ; export PATH=$PATH:~/bin
replace ~/bin/winefox with ~/Desktop/winefox
ln: target `/home/tyler/Desktop/winefox' is not a directory
do you have a ~/Desktop folder?
I'm using Xubuntu; that ~/Desktop hint was just an assumption
mkdir: cannot create directory `/home/tyler/bin': File exists
oh, then ~/bin may already be in your PATH. what's the output of echo $PATH?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/23706
